selected_quotes: This from Lance Waller is brilliant for academic data scientists
Preprint: Documenting and evaluating Data Science contributions in academic promotion in Statistics + Biostatistics
Documenting and evaluating Data Science contributions in academic promotion in stats/biostats depts
Article from Lance Waller at Emory about how academia can recognize contributions to data science
Brilliant distinction (roughly fits my experience) .. Data Scientist: upstart, tech-savvy prodigy Statistician: curmudgeonly expert

citation.title: Documenting and evaluating Data Science contributions in academic promotion in Departments of Statistics and Biostatistics

author.name: Jeff Leek
author.description: Associate Professor @ JHBSPH, co-editor Simply Statistics, co-editor Biostatistics, co-director JHU Data Science Lab. Views tweeted are my own.

author.name: Michael Blum
author.description: Data scientist in population genetics @CNRS and @UGrenobleAlpes. Director of @grenobledata. Use #rstats

author.name: Mark Robinson
author.description: statistical bioinformatics; swissified canadian; big fan of the method; occasional cyclist and runner; assoc prof; father; #methodsmatter #rstats

author.name: David Nicholson
author.description: Neuroscientist: How the brain learns and produces motor skills like speech. Pythonista. Open science (https://github.com/NickleDave). Bailador a medio tiempo

author.name: Stephen Turner
author.description: #Bioinformatics Core Director at @UVA. Blogger at http://gettinggeneticsdone.com, biologist, statistician, patent agent, brewer, runner, guitar noise-maker.

author.name: Preprints in Bio/CS
author.description: PeerJ Preprints is for rapid communication, early findings, or registered reports in Bio, Med & Computer Science. Preprints are not peer reviewed. DOIs minted.
